feeds.name: AbuseIPDB
feeds.description: AbuseIPDB is a project dedicated to helping combat the spread of hackers, spammers, and abusive activity on the internet. It's mission is to help make Web safer by providing a central blacklist for webmasters, system administrators, and other interested parties to report and find IP addresses that have been associated with malicious activity online.

feeds.name: Alexa Top 1 Million sites
feeds.description: The top 1 Million sites from Amazon(Alexa). Never use this as a whitelist.

feeds.name: APT Groups and Operations
feeds.description: A spreadsheet containing information and intelligence about APT groups, operations and tactics.

feeds.name: Binary Defense IP Banlist
feeds.description: Binary Defense Systems Artillery Threat Intelligence Feed and IP Banlist Feed.

feeds.name: BGP Ranking
feeds.description: Ranking of ASNs having the most malicious content.

feeds.name: Botnet Tracker
feeds.description: Tracks several active botnets.

feeds.name: BOTVRIJ.EU
feeds.description: Botvrij.eu provides different sets of open source IOCs that you can use in your security devices to detect possible malicious activity.

feeds.name: BruteForceBlocker
feeds.description: BruteForceBlocker is a perl script that monitors a server's sshd logs and identifies brute force attacks, which it then uses to automatically configure firewall blocking rules and submit those IPs back to the project site.

feeds.name: C&C Tracker
feeds.description: A feed of known, active and non-sinkholed C&C IP addresses, from Bambenek Consulting. Requires license for commercial use.

feeds.name: CertStream
feeds.description: Real-time certificate transparency log update stream. See SSL certificates as they're issued in real time.

feeds.name: CCSS Forum Malware Certificates
feeds.description: The following is a list of digital certificates that have been reported by the forum as possibly being associated with malware to various certificate authorities. This information is intended to help prevent companies from using digital certificates to add legitimacy to malware and encourage prompt revocation of such certificates.

feeds.name: CI Army List
feeds.description: A subset of the commercial CINS Score list, focused on poorly rated IPs that are not currently present on other threatlists.

feeds.name: Cisco Umbrella
feeds.description: Probable Whitelist of the top 1 million sites resolved by Cisco Umbrella (was OpenDNS).

feeds.name: Cloudmersive Virus Scan
feeds.description: Cloudmersive Virus Scan APIs scan files, URLs, and cloud storage for viruses. They leverage continuously updated signatures for millions of threats, and advanced high-performance scanning capabilities. The service is free, but requires you register for an account to retrieve your personal API key.

feeds.name: CrowdSec Console
feeds.description: The largest crowd-sourced CTI, updated in near real-time, thanks to CrowdSec a next-gen, open-source, free, and collaborative IDS/IPS software. CrowdSec is able to analyze visitor behavior & provide an adapted response to all kinds of attacks. Users can share their alerts about threats with the community and benefit from the network effect. The IP addresses are collected from real attacks and are not coming exclusively from a honeypot network.

feeds.name: Cyber Cure free intelligence feeds
feeds.description: Cyber Cure offers free cyber threat intelligence feeds with lists of IP addresses that are currently infected and attacking on the internet. There are list of urls used by malware and list of hash files of known malware that is currently spreading. CyberCure is using sensors to collect intelligence with a very low false positive rate.

feeds.name: Cyware Threat Intelligence Feeds
feeds.description: Cyware's Threat Intelligence feeds brings to you the valuable threat data from a wide range of open and trusted sources to deliver a consolidated stream of valuable and actionable threat intelligence. Our threat intel feeds are fully compatible with STIX 1.x and 2.0, giving you the latest information on malicious malware hashes, IPs and domains uncovered across the globe in real-time.

feeds.name: DataPlane.org
feeds.description: DataPlane.org is a community-powered Internet data, feeds, and measurement resource for operators, by operators. We provide reliable and trustworthy service at no cost.

feeds.name: Focsec.com
feeds.description: Focsec.com provides a API for detecting VPNs, Proxys, Bots and TOR requests. Always up-to-date data helps with detecting suspicious logins, fraud and abuse.

feeds.name: DigitalSide Threat-Intel
feeds.description: Contains sets of Open Source Cyber Threat Intelligence indicators, mostly based on malware analysis and compromised URLs, IPs and domains. The purpose of this project is to develop and test new ways to hunt, analyze, collect and share relevants IoCs to be used by SOC/CSIRT/CERT/individuals with minimun effort.

feeds.name: Disposable Email Domains
feeds.description: A collection of anonymous or disposable email domains commonly used to spam/abuse services.

feeds.name: DNS Trails
feeds.description: Free intelligence source for current and historical DNS information, WHOIS information, finding other websites associated with certain IPs, subdomain knowledge and technologies.

feeds.name: Emerging Threats Firewall Rules
feeds.description: A collection of rules for several types of firewalls, including iptables, PF and PIX.

feeds.name: Emerging Threats IDS Rules
feeds.description: A collection of Snort and Suricata rules files that can be used for alerting or blocking.

feeds.name: ExoneraTor
feeds.description: The ExoneraTor service maintains a database of IP addresses that have been part of the Tor network. It answers the question whether there was a Tor relay running on a given IP address on a given date.

feeds.name: Exploitalert
feeds.description: Listing of latest exploits released.

feeds.name: FastIntercept
feeds.description: Intercept Security hosts a number of free IP Reputation lists from their global honeypot network.

feeds.name: Feodo Tracker
feeds.description: The Feodo Tracker abuse.ch tracks the Feodo trojan.

feeds.name: FireHOL IP Lists
feeds.description: 400+ publicly available IP Feeds analysed to document their evolution, geo-map, age of IPs, retention policy, overlaps. The site focuses on cyber crime (attacks, abuse, malware).

feeds.name: FraudGuard
feeds.description: FraudGuard is a service designed to provide an easy way to validate usage by continuously collecting and analyzing real-time internet traffic.

feeds.name: GreyNoise
feeds.description: GreyNoise collects and analyzes data on Internet-wide scanning activity. It collects data on benign scanners such as Shodan.io, as well as malicious actors like SSH and telnet worms.

feeds.name: HoneyDB
feeds.description: HoneyDB provides real time data of honeypot activity. This data comes from honeypots deployed on the Internet using the HoneyPy honeypot. In addition, HoneyDB provides API access to collected honeypot activity, which also includes aggregated data from various honeypot Twitter feeds.

feeds.name: Icewater
feeds.description: 12,805 Free Yara rules created by Project Icewater.

feeds.name: Infosec - CERT-PA
feeds.description: Malware samples collection and analysis, blocklist service, vulnerabilities database and more. Created and managed by CERT-PA.

feeds.name: InQuest Labs
feeds.description: An open, interactive, and API driven data portal for security researchers. Search a large corpus of file samples, aggregate reputation information, and IOCs extracted from public sources. Augment YARA development with tooling to generate triggers, deal with mixed-case hex, and generate base64 compatible regular expressions.

feeds.name: I-Blocklist
feeds.description: I-Blocklist maintains several types of lists containing IP addresses belonging to various categories. Some of these main categories include countries, ISPs and organizations. Other lists include web attacks, TOR, spyware and proxies. Many are free to use, and available in various formats.

feeds.name: IPsum
feeds.description: IPsum is a threat intelligence feed based on 30+ different publicly available lists of suspicious and/or malicious IP addresses. All lists are automatically retrieved and parsed on a daily (24h) basis and the final result is pushed to this repository. List is made of IP addresses together with a total number of (black)list occurrence (for each).

feeds.name: James Brine Threat Intelligence Feeds
feeds.description: JamesBrine provides daily threat intelligence feeds for malicious IP addresses from internationally located honeypots on cloud and private infrastructure covering a variety of protocols including SSH, FTP, RDP, GIT, SNMP and REDIS. The previous day's IOCs are available in STIX2 as well as additional IOCs such as suspicious URIs and newly registered domains which have a high probaility of use in phishing campaigns.

feeds.name: Kaspersky Threat Data Feeds
feeds.description: Continuously updated and inform your business or clients about risks and implications associated with cyber threats. The real-time data helps you to mitigate threats more effectively and defend against attacks even before they are launched. Demo Data Feeds contain truncated sets of IoCs (up to 1%) compared to the commercial ones.

feeds.name: Majestic Million
feeds.description: Probable Whitelist of the top 1 million web sites, as ranked by Majestic. Sites are ordered by the number of referring subnets.

feeds.name: Maldatabase
feeds.description: Maldatabase is designed to help malware data science and threat intelligence feeds. Provided data contain good information about, among other fields, contacted domains, list of executed processes and dropped files by each sample. These feeds allow you to improve your monitoring and security tools. Free services are available for Security Researchers and Students.

feeds.name: Malpedia
feeds.description: The primary goal of Malpedia is to provide a resource for rapid identification and actionable context when investigating malware. Openness to curated contributions shall ensure an accountable level of quality in order to foster meaningful and reproducible research.

feeds.name: MalShare.com
feeds.description: The MalShare Project is a public malware repository that provides researchers free access to samples.

feeds.name: Maltiverse
feeds.description: The Maltiverse Project is a big and enriched IoC database where is possible to make complex queries, and aggregations to investigate about malware campaigns and its infrastructures. It also has a great IoC bulk query service.

feeds.name: MalwareBazaar
feeds.description: MalwareBazaar is a project from abuse.ch with the goal of sharing malware samples with the infosec community, AV vendors and threat intelligence providers.

feeds.name: Malware Domain List
feeds.description: A searchable list of malicious domains that also performs reverse lookups and lists registrants, focused on phishing, trojans, and exploit kits.

feeds.name: Malware Patrol
feeds.description: Malware Patrol provides block lists, data feeds and threat intelligence to companies of all sizes. Because our specialty is cyber threat intelligence, all our resources go into making sure it is of the highest quality possible. We believe a security team and it's tools are only as good as the data used. This means our feeds are not filled with scraped, unverified indicators. We value quality over quantity.

feeds.name: Malware-Traffic-Analysis.net
feeds.description: This blog focuses on network traffic related to malware infections. Contains traffic analysis exercises, tutorials, malware samples, pcap files of malicious network traffic, and technical blog posts with observations.

feeds.name: MalwareDomains.com
feeds.description: The DNS-BH project creates and maintains a listing of domains that are known to be used to propagate malware and spyware. These can be used for detection as well as prevention (sinkholing DNS requests).

feeds.name: MetaDefender Cloud
feeds.description: MetaDefender Cloud Threat Intelligence Feeds contains top new malware hash signatures, including MD5, SHA1, and SHA256. These new malicious hashes have been spotted by MetaDefender Cloud within the last 24 hours. The feeds are updated daily with newly detected and reported malware to provide actionable and timely threat intelligence.

feeds.name: Netlab OpenData Project
feeds.description: The Netlab OpenData project was presented to the public first at ISC' 2016 on August 16, 2016. We currently provide multiple data feeds, including DGA, EK, MalCon, Mirai C2, Mirai-Scanner, Hajime-Scanner and DRDoS Reflector.

feeds.name: NoThink!
feeds.description: SNMP, SSH, Telnet Blacklisted IPs from Matteo Cantoni's Honeypots

feeds.name: NormShield Services
feeds.description: NormShield Services provide thousands of domain information (including whois information) that potential phishing attacks may come from. Breach and blacklist services also available. There is free sign up for public services for continuous monitoring.

feeds.name: NovaSense Threats
feeds.description: NovaSense is the Snapt threat intelligence center, and provides insights and tools for pre-emptive threat protection and attack mitigation. NovaSense protects clients of all sizes from attackers, abuse, botnets, DoS attacks and more.

feeds.name: Obstracts
feeds.description: The RSS reader for cybersecurity teams. Turn any blog into structured and actionable threat intelligence.

feeds.name: OpenPhish Feeds
feeds.description: OpenPhish receives URLs from multiple streams and analyzes them using its proprietary phishing detection algorithms. There are free and commercial offerings available.

feeds.name: 0xSI_f33d
feeds.description: Free service for detecting possbible phishing and malware domains, blacklisted IPs within the Portuguese cyberspace.

feeds.name: PhishTank
feeds.description: PhishTank delivers a list of suspected phishing URLs. Their data comes from human reports, but they also ingest external feeds where possible. It's a free service, but registering for an API key is sometimes necessary.

feeds.name: PickupSTIX
feeds.description: PickupSTIX is a feed of free, open-source, and non-commercialized cyber threat intelligence. Currently, PickupSTIX uses three public feeds and distributes about 100 new pieces of intelligence each day. PickupSTIX translates the various feeds into STIX, which can communicate with any TAXII server. The data is free to use and is a great way to begin using cyber threat intelligence.

feeds.name: REScure Threat Intel Feed
feeds.description: [RES]cure is an independant threat intelligence project performed by the Fruxlabs Crack Team to enhance their understanding of the underlying architecture of distributed systems, the nature of threat intelligence and how to efficiently collect, store, consume and distribute threat intelligence. Feeds are generated every 6 hours.

feeds.name: RST Cloud Threat Intel Feed
feeds.description: Aggregated Indicators of Compromise collected and cross-verified from multiple open and community-supported sources, enriched and ranked using our intelligence platform.

feeds.name: Rutgers Blacklisted IPs
feeds.description: IP List of SSH Brute force attackers is created from a merged of locally observed IPs and 2 hours old IPs registered at badip.com and blocklist.de

feeds.name: SANS ICS Suspicious Domains
feeds.description: The Suspicious Domains Threat Lists by SANS ICS tracks suspicious domains. It offers 3 lists categorized as either high, medium or low sensitivity, where the high sensitivity list has fewer false positives, whereas the low sensitivity list with more false positives. There is also an approved whitelist of domains.

feeds.name: SecurityScorecard IoCs
feeds.description: Public access IoCs from technical blogs posts and reports by SecurityScorecard.

feeds.name: Stixify
feeds.description: Your automated threat intelligence analyst. Extract machine readable intelligence from unstructured data.

feeds.name: signature-base
feeds.description: A database of signatures used in other tools by Neo23x0.

feeds.name: The Spamhaus project
feeds.description: The Spamhaus Project contains multiple threatlists associated with spam and malware activity.

feeds.name: SophosLabs Intelix
feeds.description: SophosLabs Intelix is the threat intelligence platform that powers Sophos products and partners. You can access intelligence based on file hash, url etc. as well as submit samples for analysis. Through REST API's you can easily and quickly add this threat intelligence to your systems.

feeds.name: Spur
feeds.description: Spur provides tools and data to detect VPNs, Residential Proxies, and Bots. Free plan allows users to lookup an IP and get its classification, VPN provider, popular geolocations behind the IP, and some more useful context.

feeds.name: SSL Blacklist
feeds.description: SSL Blacklist (SSLBL) is a project maintained by abuse.ch. The goal is to provide a list of bad SSL certificates identified by abuse.ch to be associated with malware or botnet activities. SSLBL relies on SHA1 fingerprints of malicious SSL certificates and offers various blacklists

feeds.name: Statvoo Top 1 Million Sites
feeds.description: Probable Whitelist of the top 1 million web sites, as ranked by Statvoo.

feeds.name: Strongarm
feeds.description: Strongarm is a DNS blackhole that takes action on indicators of compromise by blocking malware command and control. Strongarm aggregates free indicator feeds, integrates with commercial feeds, utilizes Percipient's IOC feeds, and operates DNS resolvers and APIs for you to use to protect your network and business. Strongarm is free for personal use.

feeds.name: SIEM Rules
feeds.description: Your detection engineering database. View, modify, and deploy SIEM rules for threat hunting and detection.

feeds.name: Talos
feeds.description: Cisco Talos Intelligence Group is one of the largest commercial threat intelligence teams in the world, comprised of world-class researchers, analysts and engineers. These teams are supported by unrivaled telemetry and sophisticated systems to create accurate, rapid and actionable threat intelligence for Cisco customers, products and services.

feeds.name: threatfeeds.io
feeds.description: threatfeeds.io lists free and open-source threat intelligence feeds and sources and provides direct download links and live summaries.

feeds.name: threatfox.abuse.ch
feeds.description: ThreatFox is a free platform from abuse.ch with the goal of sharing indicators of compromise (IOCs) associated with malware with the infosec community, AV vendors and threat intelligence providers.

feeds.name: Technical Blogs and Reports, by ThreatConnect
feeds.description: This source is being populated with the content from over 90 open source, security blogs. IOCs (Indicators of Compromise) are parsed out of each blog and the content of the blog is formatted in markdown.

feeds.name: Threat Jammer
feeds.description: Threat Jammer is a REST API service that allows developers, security engineers, and other IT professionals to access high-quality threat intelligence data from a variety of sources and integrate it into their applications with the sole purpose of detecting and blocking malicious activity.

feeds.name: ThreatMiner
feeds.description: ThreatMiner has been created to free analysts from data collection and to provide them a portal on which they can carry out their tasks, from reading reports to pivoting and data enrichment. The emphasis of ThreatMiner isn't just about indicators of compromise (IoC) but also to provide analysts with contextual information related to the IoC they are looking at.

feeds.name: WSTNPHX Malware Email Addresses
feeds.description: Email addresses used by malware collected by VVestron Phoronix (WSTNPHX)

feeds.name: UnderAttack.today
feeds.description: UnderAttack is a free intelligence platform, it shares IPs and information about suspicious events and attacks. Registration is free.

feeds.name: URLhaus
feeds.description: URLhaus is a project from abuse.ch with the goal of sharing malicious URLs that are being used for malware distribution.

feeds.name: VirusShare
feeds.description: VirusShare.com is a repository of malware samples to provide security researchers, incident responders, forensic analysts, and the morbidly curious access to samples of malicious code. Access to the site is granted via invitation only.

feeds.name: Yara-Rules
feeds.description: An open source repository with different Yara signatures that are compiled, classified and kept as up to date as possible.

feeds.name: 1st Dual Stack Threat Feed by MrLooquer
feeds.description: Mrlooquer has created the first threat feed focused on systems with dual stack. Since IPv6 protocol has begun to be part of malware and fraud communications, It is necessary to detect and mitigate the threats in both protocols (IPv4 and IPv6).
